Definition: To make a copy of computer information.
Example: Always back up your files before updating the software.

Definition: To stop functioning (for a machine or vehicle).
Example: The car broke down in the middle of the highway.

Definition: To mention a subject or start to talk about it.
Example: Don't bring up the budget during the meeting.

Definition: To decide that a planned event will not happen.
Example: The match was called off due to heavy rain.

Definition: To suggest or think of an idea or plan.
Example: She came up with a brilliant solution to the problem.

Definition: To accept or recover from a bad experience.
Example: It took him months to get over the end of his relationship.

Definition: To feel pleased and excited about something that is going to happen.
Example: I am looking forward to meeting you next week.

Definition: To accept an unpleasant situation or person without complaining.
Example: I don't know how she puts up with his constant shouting.

Definition: To formally establish a new business or organization.
Example: They are planning to set up a new branch in Madrid.

Definition: To leave the ground and begin to fly.
Example: The plane took off exactly on time.

Definition: To become so excited that you lose control.
Example: I got a bit carried away and spent too much money.

Definition: To succeed in avoiding punishment.
Example: He thought he could get away with cheating.

Definition: To accept unpleasant behavior without complaining.
Example: I can't put up with the noise anymore.

Definition: To be similar to an older member of your family.
Example: He takes after his mother in appearance.

Definition: To admire and respect someone.
Example: I've always looked up to my older brother.

Definition: To replace something lost or provide something good.
Example: He bought flowers to make up for being late.

Definition: To represent a particular idea or word.
Example: What does the 'VIP' stand for?

Definition: To refuse an offer or invitation.
Example: They turned down my application for the job.

Definition: To solve a problem by calculation or study.
Example: I'm trying to work out how much I owe you.

Definition: To start to talk about a particular subject.
Example: I'll bring it up at the next meeting.
